storyInfo: In a small Leithanian town, Fuze searches for help fixing a water tower from the only person who knows Originium circuitry. However, this unsteady relationship is primed to explode over their clashing personalities.

attributes.content: Name yourself, stranger.
attributes.name: Haggard Noble

attributes.content: ...Fuze.
That accent... are you Ursine?
attributes.name: Haggard Noble

attributes.content: You could say that.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Haggard Noble

attributes.content: The water tower is broken. I want to fix it.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Can't you fix it yourself? What does it have to do with me?
attributes.name: Haggard Noble

attributes.content: The problem is with the pump's Originium circuit. I understand engineering, and you know Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: ...A well-armed, masked Ursine? Here to fix a water tower in a Leithanien town?
attributes.name: Haggard Noble

attributes.content: Mr. Berman...
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: Oh, it's you. What's with this man?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Vissel and I were attacked by needleflies when fetching water from the river. Vissel got hurt, but we made it back alive thanks to Fuze here.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: Vissel got hurt? Is it serious?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: He's still alive... that's all I can say. His granddaughter is by his side.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: I see. Go on.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: We invited him into town, and that's when he saw the broken water tower. He tried to fix it and found that the problem was with the Originium circuit, not the mechanical components...
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I-I'll be going.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: So you asked him if he knew anyone who knew Originium Arts, and he brought you to me.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: (Nods) I'm hoping you can help your subjects.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I'm not their lord.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: He said the Baron built this water tower many years ago. I asked him where the Baron lived, and he brought me to you.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: You heard him call me Mr. Berman, not Baron.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Very well... Mr. Berman. This is a facility that makes people's lives better.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: People used to go to the river to fetch water all the time. They managed just fine.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Maybe it was the water tower's pumps that created a space for the needleflies to make their nest.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: All I know is that Vissel wouldn't be at death's door if the water tower was fixed earlier.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What difference does one death make?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: You think his death doesn't matter?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: It's not just him.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Him, me, this whole town, all of Leithanien... all of it is irreversibly moving towards decay and death.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The difference between needlefly and old age is no more than the difference between arriving at your destination by burdenbeast or by foot.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: ...Ridiculous.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Where are you going?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: To find others.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: There's no one else in town who knows Originium circuits. Whoever brought you to me must have told you.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Then I'll research it.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Why are you so stubborn about this? Over a bunch of people whom you've just met?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: It's not about who, but what. Goodbye.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I have a few books on this topic that I bought when I was young.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: You spent a lot of time looking for them.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: It's not an easy thing, looking for books.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: 'Originium Circuit Theory and Applications', from Victoria. Wasn't easy to find a book that wasn't in Leithanian at home.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: You must have question marks written all over your face behind that mask, Ursine. You don't know why I refuse to fix the water tower, but allow you to borrow my books.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I have a theory.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Which is?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: You want to prove that fixing the water tower won't change anything.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: It's not that complicated. I'm just curious.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I thought you had completely lost interest.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Even a rock would be curious about why a heavily-armed foreigner wants to fix a water tower for your neighbor.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Either I fix it or I don't. That's all there is to it.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: No... what I'm curious is what this person has experienced, which has made him so stubborn about something that shouldn't have anything to do with him.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Would you like to stay over for the night, Mr. Fuze? Perhaps we can have a chat over dinner.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Thank you for the invitation, but I doubt we have much to talk about.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I suppose you're right.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: ...But I would still have liked to have a chat.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Shuhrat— What is it?
Sorry. Got lost in thought.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Fuze looks around him.
It is the corridor of Rhodes Island. He would not call it familiar, but it is not unknown to him either.
He has his hands around the back of his head, leaning against the wall outside Elias Kötz's quarters at Rhodes Island, waiting for 'Blitz' to come out.
It'll be a little longer. I haven't gotten used to Rhodes Island razors yet.
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: That's fine, Kötz.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Where were we? Oh, the festival we saw at Leithanien.
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: There were a thousand casters at the festival. They stood silently like statues on the plaza before the opening ceremony.
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: They were waiting for a single note from the concertmaster. The cue for them to raise their Arts Units in unison was so quiet it was almost inaudible ...
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: Come on. A reaction would be nice, you know.
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: It's hard for me to imagine it. Leithanian is too different from anything that I know. Imagine, one thousand robed, masked figures holding wands, standing on Registan Square...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Registan Square?
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: The landmark of Samarkand. You should know.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I see. I'll continue.
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: One thousand beams of Arts light shoot into the night sky. Colors clashed in the clouds and burst open, turning the entire sky into a colorful sea of flowers...
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: Application of evocation-conversion Originium Arts?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: You know Originium Arts?
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: The result of extra lessons in Dossoles.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Coal, oil, gas, even nuclear fusion... it's all been replaced by Originium. I had to learn from scratch—
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Something wrong with the razor. One moment—
attributes.name: Blitz?

attributes.content: Fuze wakes with a start. He had fallen asleep on the desk, his faced buried in the book he was reading.
Tsk... my back hurts. And my head's groggy...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: 'Festive scene witnessed by the author while visiting Leithanien...'
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: No wonder I was dreaming about it.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Something fell out... a bookmark?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I should return this with the book.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Press the switch there for me, please.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Not working.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: Looks like we need a few more books from Berman. Could you fetch them for me?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Mr. Fuze. Mr. Berman...
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: What about him? Don't tell me he does illegal stuff in secret. You were really nervous the first time I visited him.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: No, not at all! He's not a bad person. It's just... well... we don't go there unless we really need to.
attributes.name: Townsfolk

attributes.content: ...Fine, I'll go myself.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Let me see... 'Practical Manual of Home Appliances'? Isn't that a little too simple?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Just because it's simple doesn't mean it can't help. I'll take this one.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I'm curious, though... why would there be an Ursine who knows machines, but not Originium circuits?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: That's not important right now.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Why don't we set the water tower aside for a moment and talk about our own lives?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: There's no need for that.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Well, I'll start if you don't want to... starting with that water tower.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The water tower was the first step of the Baron's dream. He wanted to help the people here live better lives. He hoped this place could be a 'model town.'
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: In the end, the only thing he achieved was tap water for the townsfolk.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The Baron wanted to build a factory in town, get investments from bigwigs from the capital, make this place a center for the arts... but all his efforts ended up futile or unnoticed.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: His final attempt was the boldest, and it came closest to success. He wanted to move the entire town to a mobile platform. He had an agreement with a Vedunien factory, and paid a large amount up front—
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Then, Their Majesties visited their faithful Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Is that your story?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: ...My father's.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I was young then, still working on my university thesis about telepathic and perceptive Arts in Vedunien.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: At the end of it all, the only thing I could remember is blood. Blood of the common folk, of nobles, of the Gendarmerie, of the Kurfürsten, and of my teacher.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I barely escaped with my life, clutching the charred thesis. The first thing my father asked when I came back was how I was doing. The second thing he asked was how the factory was doing... I need not tell you the answer.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Your father died a broken man, and you never inherited his title.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I gave it up, because I realized it was all meaningless.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: ...Do you know what the biggest difference between you and your father is?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I'm all ears.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: He at least managed to give the townspeople tap water.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: If we talk about the issue at hand, your neighbors will have running water from tubes again tomorrow.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Then let's assume your work here will be done. You'll leave, not pausing for a moment.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I'm sure there are many people as stubborn as I am in Leithanien. You can see for yourself.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: No. I only learned this recently. You're one of a kind.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: One of a kind?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: It's nothing. I wish you luck in your studies.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: And if you see Vissel's granddaughter, tell her to bring him over before it's too late.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: 'Bring him over'? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Exactly that.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: This looks like a good place.
It's really dark here.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Looks like it's going to be a long time before we can go back to that place where everything doesn't run on Originium.
attributes.name: Doc?

attributes.content: I didn't know you were the kind to get homesick.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Of course. You remember the day we first came?
attributes.name: Doc?

attributes.content: I remember. We were investigating the Magnethill No.2 site and ended up landing on Reynell's golf balls.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Speaking of home, what was the name of that landmark in Samarkand... Registan Square？
attributes.name: Doc?

attributes.content: Yeah. The building with the blue dome. I can almost see the crowds on the square, the cars driving by, and the patterns on the three buildings…
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Fuze looks up from his book.
Sleep seems to come to him anytime, anywhere now. He often falls asleep halfway through a draft, and has to chase the remnants of the dream out of his mind after waking up.
The dreams were too clear, too real.
Sometimes, he even wonders if Terra was just a really, really long dream after he hit his head at Magnethill No. 2.
(Yawns)
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I can't sleep now. I need to go to the water tower... or borrow another book from Berman...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What did he say about Vissel's granddaughter? Tell her to bring him over?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Thank you for bringing Vissel over while he still draws breath. Where's his granddaughter?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: In bed. She's exhausted.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Why do you have the townspeople send the dying to you?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: I asked around. People were hesitant at first, but they eventually told me that you've been doing this for a long time.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Let me guess... you suspect I'm taking advantage of the dead?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I am a bit skeptical, assuming what you told me is true.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: It's hard to believe someone so melancholy could be that bad. Especially when they can't put in the effort to do anything.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: ...Now you've offended me, Mr. Fuze. But that's fine.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: You haven't answered my question.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Then watch. You'll understand.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The sleepiness strikes again. Fuze bites on his tongue to prevent himself from falling asleep.
Berman gazes down at the old man's clouded eyes, and places one end of his staff on the old man's forehead.
The tip of the staff begins to glow.
(Mumbled muttering)
attributes.name: Vissel

attributes.content: Levine, it's you... you came back... you really came back...
attributes.name: Vissel

attributes.content: No, don't apologize, no need to say anything... we'll go home.
attributes.name: Vissel

attributes.content: Here, an apple from the backyard... you wanted one when you left, but there wasn't any on the trees that year. I saved this one for you...
attributes.name: Vissel

attributes.content: There is no apple on the old man's hand. Berman is the only person standing before him.
Who's Levine?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Vissel's only son. He left the town more than a decade ago, after contracting Oripathy.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: What did you do to Vissel? Is he hallucinating?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Of course not. That's beyond my reach.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: All I can do is alleviate their pain, help them relax, cause them to dream when it's neither the time nor place to do so... a midday dream that I cannot interfere with.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Sounds like a doctor administrating anesthetics to a patient in pain, except there's no syringe.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: If that's how you understand it, it's not my place to say any more.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Drug abuse ruins lives.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Is it abuse to let a dying person leave in peace? Shuhrat—
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: This is the most meaningful thing that I can do for someone, Mr. Fuze.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Perhaps Vissel wouldn't be dying if you had done something about the water tower earlier.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: You're the one drowning yourself in 'medicine' instead of helping the dying.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Ha, me?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I've seen too many tragedies. The more I see of them, the more I'm convinced that I'm right.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Catastrophe, intrigue, war, Originium, even minor accidents... the life and will of man is ever fragile before them, like dust in the wind.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: And soon I'll be gone with the wind too.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Berman unbuttons his shirt and reveals the Originium crystal formations in his abdomen.
On the way back from Zwillingstürme, I found that I had a little black rock by the side of my ribs, one last parting gift from Vedunien.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: It has almost consumed me, and so I decided to commit a crime for the first and last time in my life.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Crime?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: There is a lot of complicated preparation to be done in order for my Arts to work on a healthy and uncooperative mind. I'm sorry for doing this to you.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: It began as curiosity about what this quiet man of action talks about in his sleep, so I did something to the book and bookmark that I lent you.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Then, I heard you talk in your dream, about something beyond my wildest imagination... a blue sky, sky without a single trace of Originium.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I don't expect to go with you to that place without Originium. I don't even expect to become friends with you. After all, you don't like people who don't talk about practical things, do you?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: And so, I must use my Arts... so that we can finish this last midday dream together.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I'm sorry to make you stay with a dying patient in his final moments, but he has been alone for too long.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Berman points his wand at Fuze before he could react.
Fuze is overcome by sleepiness.
He hears the flows of an undercurrent, pulling his drifting consciousness below the surface.
Shuhrat! Wake up!
*Cough,* *cough*...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Good, you're awake. Lucky for you, you saved yourself a bit of pain. Grab your gear. We're leaving.
Where are we?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Magnethill No.2. The tremors have passed. You seem to have hit your head.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: There's nothing unusual in the labs. Doc and the others have already left. Investigation into any possible connections to Levi will have to wait until next time.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Mm... hm.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Do you have any vacation plans?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Vacation?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: You forgot that too? You really did hit your head hard, didn't you?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: I need some help picking out a good place to relax.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: How about Samarkand? I hear Registan Square is beautiful.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: A place where I can lie down for a whole day, thinking about nothing.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: But... wait... there's something I still need to do...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: I don't know, but... Originium...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Originium? What's that? Did you have a dream while you were out cold?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: I mean... have you ever heard of Originium?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: You can't expect other people to understand what happens in your dreams.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Sorry... it's just that the word left an impression on me.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: There's no point in dwelling on it. It's better to just focus on Registan Square. You should come with me.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Your cas— I mean, scientists, the best ones—
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: No, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: I'm just happy that I'm visiting your homeland.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: A place with no catastrophe, no war, no tragedies.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: No... tragedies?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Shuhrat? What is it?
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: Do you remember Oregon?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Shuhrat—
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: Tell me, what do you think of Oregon?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: O-Oregon? A good place for artists, with nice museums, orchestras...
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: What about Baghdad? Lebanon? Moscow?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Shuhrat, listen...
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: Did you think that without Originium—
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: No, no!
attributes.name: Ela?

attributes.content: —Without Originium, there won't be any tragedies, Berman?
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: (Forced smile) Of course not, Shuhrat.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Perhaps it would all happen again, absent Originium. But don't be so hard on a dying patient's dream.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Maybe you should go and see the places that I talked about. See what happened to my home without Originium.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: There's no need. I take it that no less blood was spilled there than Vedunien that autumn.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: It's not the amount of bloodshed that matters.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Ha... you're one to talk now, Shuhrat.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The Arts have failed. You can no longer tell me what it looks like beneath that blue sky, nor can I experience it again through your narration.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Go, before I turn to a pile of dust. Bring my first and final crime to a painless end.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: What is it? You wanted to talk to a man who achieved nothing?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Perhaps there are less tragedies in this world... these lands... than you think.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Then what did I see in Vedunien? What did you see in the places that you talked about?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Chaos.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Chaos is just that. Sometimes it brings destruction and other times, it guides you through it.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Chaos doesn't always end in tragedy, unless...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Unless no one takes action?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Perhaps, Shuhrat. But it's too late.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Too late.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Does the soul linger after death?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I know little about this topic.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: It's fine. I'm just thinking... if it does, do you think my soul can visit the Samarkand of your memories, and see the blue dome above?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: If you wish...
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: ...I'm not opposed to telling you how it looks, of my own volition.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Am I still worthy to hear it?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Don't leave this world without achieving anything.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: The haggard man's eyes go wide, then he laughs feebly.
Perhaps the reason that you don't like to talk is you're too smart. Smart people are good at offending others.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Fuze shrugs and begins to describe the plaza and the nearby buildings, in as much detail as possible.
Berman raises his wand, and a lifelike model of Registan Square begins to form before the desk.
...Looks just like it. Almost identical.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Good to hear.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: Where will you go?
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: The water tower. I'll stay in town a little longer, finish what you could not.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: Go. Take Vissel home. Let him spend his last moments with his granddaughter.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: I will. Goodbye.
attributes.name: Fuze

attributes.content: ...Take care.
attributes.name: Berman

attributes.content: As the door locks behind Fuze, Berman raises his wand with what little strength he has left.
There is no music, only the sound of doors and windows sealing.
The wand falls to the ground, but Berman could no longer hear it. He feels the blue dome of the model, imagining the sky of the same color, the sky he hasn't, and won't be able to see.
